topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/532ff1ec6368727a04840000#post_532ff1ec6368727a04840000
Exactly my point. It doesn't make the game more rewarding.
In Skyrim the added difficulty almost works as you get more experience that way due to the way TES games have you accrue experience.
 
Less so for Fallout 3 as it only buffs experience on enemy kills (a small portion of your xp); more importantly F3 already gives you too much experience as it is so hardly a big deal if you miss out on it

topics.body:
I have over 1000 hours on Skyrim for PC with mods and have not defeated Alduin. I usually delete my characters after level 40. 

It's always "Should've been a mage" or "should've been a archer" or "should've been a sword and board warrior" or should've been a two hander warrior" or "should've been X race" or "should've been a female character with the skimpy armor mods". 

I don't know what makes me keep playing it, but maybe it's because of the simplicity of the combat and the stress free world. If I ever manage to get all the achievements, maybe I'll go outside and find a cat to keep me company while I finish all those other steam games I've never played.
topics.author: 4fe576197f123b33fb0006b5
